pageContext.description:
Copper alloy blade, probably a blade edge fragment from a Bronze Age axe of indeterminate type and date.

The axe is fragmentary, represented by the blade edge only (with a width of 36.5mm, a surviving length of 14.0mm, a maximum surviving thickness of 6.0mm and a weight of 11.0g). The break occurred in antiquity and there is no socket base evident on the fragment. The blade edge is convex and is incomplete, with approximately two-thirds represented. The original edge has been lost through corrosion. The surface is heavily-pitted and corroded and very little of original surface survives with a green-black patina.
pageContext.notes: The small fragment represented makes any identification uncertain.
